DOC.brief_title: Interventions Prevent Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes From Long-term Complications
DOC.detailed_description: Diabetes mellitus type1 require lifelong insulin substitution , aim near normal glycaemia . Insufficient metabolic control ( HbA1c > 8 % ) lead micro macro- vascular complication . Especially adolescence lack compliance lead deteriorate metabolic control . Motivational factor play pivotal role age-group , however neither study far consider intervention diabetes patient . Therefore , aim study evaluate multi-centred randomized control trial effectiveness diabetes management training method Motivational Interviewing element Cognitive Behaviour Therapy E-mail support . Sixty adolescent within age group 13-20 year HbA1c level > 8 % - refresher course diabetes education - involve 2-weekly individual intervention session include motivational interview CBT-modules psychologist weekly e-mail support period six month order improve HbA1c level , self- efficacy diabetes management general quality life . As control group sixty adolescent within age group 13-20 year HbA1c level > 8 - refresher course diabetes education - get treatment usual , include routine medical support visit , unspecific psychological consultation unspecific e-mail support match intervention group time bonus . We assess motivational change effect metabolic control ( HbA1c ) define predictor positive effect glycaemic control .
